Class TransformImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ontal.imgutil.scaling.TransformImage
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AdjustImage, ExpandImage, FitImage, LimitImage, TileImage

extends Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • TransformImage

        protected TransformImage​(BufferedImage inputImage)
        Default base constructor. Initializes base input image parameters like image dimensions and ratio, as well as its bitmap type.
        Parameters:
        inputImage - input image

    • Method Detail

      • transform

        public BufferedImage transform​(Object... args)
        Main transformation entry point. Obtains all additional parameters required for image particular processing.
        Parameters:
        args - transformation arguments
        Returns:
        scaled image

      • validateArguments

        protected void validateArguments​(Object... args)
        Validates transformation arguments and throws an IllegalArgumentException if any of the validations fail.
        Parameters:
        args - transformation arguments

      • process

        protected abstract BufferedImage process()
        Main image processing method that implements the algorithm required to achieve a particular scaling transformation.
        Returns:
        scaled image

        protected int calculateOutputWidth​(Object... args)

        Returns:

      • calculateOutputHeight

        protected int calculateOutputHeight​(Object... args)
        Obtains output image height based on the provided arguments.
        Parameters:
        args - transformation arguments
        Returns:
        image height

      • requiresUnsharpening

        protected boolean requiresUnsharpening​(int width,
                                       int height)
        Helps to determine if the output image requires additional unsharpening. This is useful for small images that get too sharp after downscaling.
        Parameters:
        width - image width
        height - image width
        Returns:
        true if the image requires unsharpening, otherwise false
